channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023110033
item.description:
Report E-2023110033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was impacted by a skid and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3/OMI (E3) to remediate the impacted site. . E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the printing ink-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. They cut up the impacted pallet and all spent absorbents and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon over pack for transport and disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 1-gallon spill of UN1789 "BLUE WHALE MURIATIC ACID" from a 1-gallon plastic jug caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their dock floor. A contractor was contacted to assist with the cleanup of material.

item.title: Report E-2023110010
item.description:
Report E-2023110010

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN2810 Durez 04347A Liquid One Step Phenolic Resin release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110008
item.description:
Report E-2023110008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a broken pallet puncture, approximately .5 cup of Velocity Automotive Fast Thinner 2005G (Hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 20 gallon poly drum and staged onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110002
item.description:
Report E-2023110002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Makeup fluid 99-76SR (UN1210) were released from a 1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3213614. (1) 5-gallon DM w/plastic liner containing four 1-gallon plastic jugs of Makeup fluid 99-76SR and oil dri was collected as waste and staged onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110001
item.description:
Report E-2023110001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IT was reported a one-quart release of regulated UN1219 "LOCTITE X33-08I" was released at Terminal LAB. (1) five-gallon plastic jug was damaged due to a forklift puncture that occurred during dock operations impacting Dock #59. The terminal felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 20-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, damaged plastic jug, and the remaining material, and issued PPE was created.

item.title: Report E-2023100921
item.description:
Report E-2023100921

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a weeping weld 1 cup of material has been released onto the concrete floor, a contractor was required for the transfer of the product. It was determined that the tote could not be repaired and the product will need to be transferred. There was 350 Gallons of product in the leaking tote. All impacted surfaces were wiped down with water and the 1 cup of material released was absorbed into pads and containerized. The material remaining in the damaged tote was transferred to two new totes and they will continue to the destination. Terminal staff advised that the leaking steel tote will be returned to the shipper. (1) 5G DF - Impacted pads was created for waste and was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100910
item.description:
Report E-2023100910

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LAREDO

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1263 was discovered to have a leaking patched and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crews deployed granular absorbents to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. E3 personnel containerized all UN1263-impacted absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CONDUCTING A SWEEP OF THE UNLOAD DOORS, WHEN HE NOTICED A PACKAGE ON THE GRADING. PACKAGE SHOWED STAINS OF LEAKAGE, WITH FULL PPE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE APPORIATE RESPONSE SHEET (NO LABEL ON BOX OR UNKNOWN, UNDECLARED). THEN BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023100065
item.description:
Report X-2023100065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA inspected CBTX 735484 & found the vacuum breaker to be releasing vapor. Vacuum breaker was cleaned by emergency responder SRS, removing grime from the seating disk and vapor leak stopped, verified onsite with snoop liquid leak detector. The shipper Marathon Petroleum is having the car certified leak tested.

item.title: Report X-2023090443
item.description:
Report X-2023090443

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA was inspecting cars a spotted residue on the side of CBTX 735329 opened the combination housing. Inside the housing found the liquid valve to be seeping at the base of the valve where it threads into the tank car. . Marathon Petroleum sent out there emergency responder SRS to remove the valve. Once the valve had been removed and visually inspected lack of thread sealant was deemed the reason why the valve was leaking. CBTX 735329 was then set out on the Rip track so it can have a certified leak test preformed.

NONE OF THE 3 CONTAINERS PRESENT HAD LOOSE CAPS OR WERE ACTIVELY LEAKING BUT LIQUID WAS SEEN ON THE OUTSIDE OF ONE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED IN A DRUM FOR INSPECTION BUT WAS NOT LEAKING WHEN FOUND.

item.title: Report X-2023081336
item.description:
Report X-2023081336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Liquid line valve was found leaking from the liquid valve plug. The valve was defective and the plug was loose, BNSF responders tighten the plug to stop the leak.

item.title: Report I-2023080017
item.description:
Report I-2023080017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: ROBSTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS EAGLE PROPANE L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AmeriGas vehicle traveling northbound on Hwy 77 at posted speed. Third party vehicle rear ended AmeriGas vehicle causing third party vehicle to be totaled. Due to impact, AmeriGas rear deck piping ripped or torn causing release of propane. Responding HazMat team was able to make safe releasing product and vehicles were towed from scene.
